header.rec_loc: A car journey from Manchester to Cornwall (going on holiday)
header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Holiday packing, holidays, weather, decorating/ house, birthday/meal, Indian food, cooking, food
header.activity: Father and daughter converse on journey to Cornwall (summer holiday)

body.u: yeah
do you want a drink of anything?
yeah I might do hope I've got everything
well it looks like you've got most things you own in that big bag
yeah pretty much
well I'm surprised I've got three bags clothes the rest of it's like food and bits and pieces I've bought I've bought an iron this time
oh
I'm just not sure what'll be in these I mean in the last place it had iron and ironing board didn't it?
well I just like brought quite a lot of stuff
yeah it's better to have it there's plenty of room in the car so you may as well
yeah that's what I thought
and if you got a clothing for each day at least you cos there's probably washing machine on on the site
yeah
but you'd probably better not have to start washing and stuff isn't it?
yeah
when you can bring enough clothes to the waterpark so
I always feel like I've forgotten something but I don't think there's anything that I would forget
your toiletries and it looks like you have plenty of clothes that's all you need really isn't it?
yeah and I mean if I've forgot like and I don't have any toothpaste but I thought you'd bring that
oh right yeah
but like if I forgot something like soap or something like I could just buy some
yeah and I've I've bought just clean stuff extra stuff like that cos you don't know what stuff will be there
oh did you yeah did you bring a spray? a side spray and?
yeah yeah
oh good good
cos I think last time I gave the place a spray down in the kitchen
yo yeah cos you weren't going to and then we were at the shop and I was like let's get one
oh did I not bring one no?
no I don't think so and I was like oh wait we should get one and erm I went a bit mad with the spray
did you do it?
yeah do you not remember? we had to open all the doors
yeah I
I was like
yeah so I think iit's not a bad day for travelling really it's just not too hot
no yeah I thought it was going to be roasting
roasting and horrible
because I woke up this morning and I was like I was so warm
yeah it seemed to be quite bright and warm earlier on it's clouded over
but then I went outside cos I heard the cats and I said I better so I went out and I was like it's freezing
maybe your house holds the heat longer
yeah I think it does
so your mammy's room it's erm
yeah it's done
looking good isn't it? it's yours next
yeah I think they were waiting for me to go
it will be nice when you go away and you come back and it'll be much improved won't it?
yeah yeah yeah
it must be a bit chaotic living there at the moment is it?
er yeah I don't know
well especially with your your grandma and grandad having to sleep in the lounge in his boxers on and I mean where do you go when you want to where you can relax and sit down?
in my room
what about when you're eating?
in the kitchen
oh right cos there's nowhere really if you all want to sit down and talk or eat or anything?
we've been in the garden or in the kitchen
mm
like we never sat in the lounge really in our other house
did you not?
no I never really used it I was always in my room anyway
well your kitchen was a more reasonable size though wasn't it? you could all sit in there and
yeah oh we went out for erm grandad's birthday to that Indian on Saturday
yeah I meant to
it was so nice that Indian yeah it was really nice yeah
good
yeah
what did you have?

I had oh I don't know what it's called it's l it's like it tasted almost like a korma but I thought wouldn't get a korma it was like a sweeter one it had like mangos and pineapple and coconut or something it was really nice we had it with chicken
oh that's oh so it wasn't vegetarian?
no they I don't they didn't really have that much vegetarian stuff I don't know if you can ask
cos proper well proper Indian cooking is isn't it?
yeah yeah it's really nice
cos mainly cos most of a lot are vegetarians aren't they? in
yeah
more of it's vegetarian food I mean what did your grandma have? did she have like English
she had like a lentils thing she really liked it yeah
oh so it wasn't too spicy?
no well I had a sweet one and she had one that was like well it wasn't spicy at all it said mild
mm
and it wasn't spicy cos I tried it and it had like lentils in it or something
oh right
I think grandad had a a balti
oh
and mammy had a korma cos I was going to
so everyone enjoyed it?
yeah
did you have poppadoms and things first?
I had a well had poppadoms but we didn't get erm other starters because you you can't
no it's too filling
we barely even ate the curry
yeah but the poppodoms are not too filling are they? always worth having
yeah
what time did you go there?
about seven
was it busy?
it was actually we almost didn't get a table
really?
yeah because
why did you not book it?
well no because eh we thought it wouldn't be that busy we were going to go a little bit ea
yeah seven's quite busy

yeah we thought it wouldn't be that busy erm and on the website it didn't really you know say like oh book you know cos some of them do they say like oh we're quite busy and whatever so you should book
mm
and it didn't say anything like that we went and they were like oh no we've got no rooms and we were like leaving and the guy came after us and was like no no we've found you a table so
oh right
yeah
that would have been a bit of a shame what would you have done?
I don't know
looked for somewhere else?
yeah probably but they probably thought there's like four of them
yeah
we should try and get them in somewhere yeah it was really busy cos we were thinking like oh is grandma going to like it cos grandma and grandad don't really go out to eat anywhere
yeah
and we didn't know if they would like tha well we thought grandad would like the Indian but we weren't sure about grandma but she was like oh it's really nice
really?
yeah
well I've I I've brought lots of vegetables for you
have you?

to practise being a vegetarian I was thinking about well depending seeing what time they get there cos it's probably not much time to pop out and top up supplies but doing something like a vegetable curry for you but I don't know if you're going to be in the mood for that
mm I'm not really I don't know like I'm quite fussy about curries I don't really like
no I wasn't going to do it spicy
mm
chilli spicy you can add chilli to it if you wanted to but things like butternut squash aubergines peppers it's really nice one of those
ah yes do you know I love butternut squash?
you know the actual vegetables that I'm I was going to use
yeah
I've done it a couple of times and I've got a mangos in it as well
ah butternut squash butternut squash is like the best
so it's quite different
it's so nice but we never buy it cos I can't peel it and it's us
well no you either put the thing in and what you have to help
cos the whole point of it is so you can
well I've actually found out a good way of peeling butternut squash we just don't but it usually cos it's a bit expensive
well what I do is I I cut it into little smaller manageable chunks and peel it
but it's not like a well I've found a good way because usually
what's that?
the skin's really hard and I just can't get my knife into it and I end up like cutting my hand open
you need a small knife though to do it

but I can do it with a peeler now because what you do is I I found this on some cooking website cos I was like I need some help I really like butternut squash but I can't cook it so I looked it up online and it's like right what you have to do is you poke loads of holes in it stick it in the microwave and it softens the skin and you can just peel it off cos it's like it's not it's not like cooked
it just softens
obv yeah it's like it gets quite soft so you can peel it
oh right how many? how long do you have to put it in the microwave for?
a few minutes
what? the whole butternut squash?

yeah you just sort of spin it round but erm cos I put mine in for quite long and it kind of started cooking a bit but it's alright if you're just going to like cook it anyway it's like quite soft and squishy anyway isn't it?
yeah but you don't want to the cooking process in the microwave the best way is if you're cooking something is to you know? like butternut squash it
why?
cos you get more of the flavours then don't you? and the actual whole dish if you're putting it in with other things
yeah
and it's like it's nice like in a curry slow cooked on a low heat and you get a it just goes soft and there's more flavour if you do it that way
yeah but you're just going to put it in anyway
yeah but iiiit's how you cook things and combine them that makes the flavours if you microwave it you don't get that same
yeah but you don't microwave all of it
well I know yeah but you'll you'll microwave quite an important element possibly
what? the bit under the skin?
well that's the flesh yeah it's alright if the skin softens a bit but once it starts cooking it's the flesh it's you're changing the cooking process
it's an exact science to cook things properly
I know but it just
it's like mixing chemicals in the wrong e order but erm I use like a you know a paring knife? quite a sharp small one
I thought pepeople I can't peel with a knife I have to peel with an a peeler because I just end up cutting my fingers
but you can't peel everything with a peeler can you?
well I've managed alright
yeah?
yeah
I didn't bring the peeler
I'm just I either I either cut my fingers or I like take off half of the vegetable
ah
cos I'm trying not to cut my fingers
well what kind of? w is it quite a sharp knife you use?
yeah
you just have you're your hand you're holding with away from so you hold it there and peel that way
so how are you going to cut it if it's not in the vicinity of?
it slips or like it jams into me and the I'm like nearly stabbing myself and
yeah but if it if it slips it's going to go that way
yeah up your arm
well you you have to learn some knife skills
or I could just use a safe peeler now don't they usually say cooking is an art but baking is a science
because baking is like the wweighing and the measuring and that
yeah you have to
yeah and the the coo the cooking's a bit like
yeah you can have a bit more throwing things together depending on what you want but like the serious chefs you know? you're cooking like these Michelin star
well it looks art doesn't it? when they put it when they put it on the plate it looks like a painting
well yeah exacting on how they do things
looks good
we can get away with whatever can't we?
no but I think those Michelin chefs would agree that cooking is an art form
yeah maybe
they ththey they're all you know what I mean? you see you see these like
there is a science to it you have to understand how ingredients go together
yeah well that well you could ararguably you could say the same for painting because painting involves chemicals and things but you'd never call painting a science
erm no cos I mean they're not making the paint are they?
no but like the like the when you mi like mixed media
mm
mixed forms like you can't erm really like you can't paint over acrylics in watercolours can you?
no I mean well I suppose when you get to the down to all the nitty gritty there's there's science in everything really isn't there really?
well yeah
nothing works without science
yeah ah we stopping already?
yeah I've got to get fuel we won't get very far with the amount of fuel that I have
oh can I get some Nectar points?
yeah?
oh do you not do Nectar?
no
think I've got a Nectar card I don't know if I've brought it I'll check
I'll start filling it up you can just pass it out to me when I'm
okay yeah
or else can I do it at the pump here? no?
can't you?
